ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] PublicSuffixes implementation doesn't behave as expected
ygData.msgSnippet: Thanks for giving this brand-new feature a close look! It should definitely handle - in domain segments, as that is legal and common. However, I note that

Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] PublicSuffixes implementation doesn't behave
 as expected
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=137285340; y=VKmYcs-uK_E8iqJG7kbXmaCKfth0vUT3o9WVsKPNsTOc
X-Yahoo-Profile: gojomo

Thanks for giving this brand-new feature a close look!

It should definitely handle '-' in domain segments, as that is legal and 
common. However, I note that you've also enabled '+'. As far as I know, 
that's illegal. Are you encountering sites with '+' in their domain-names?

- Gordon @ IA


pandae667 wrote:
> Hi Gordon,
> 
> during some updating/testing I tried the PublicSuffixes implementation
> and found it not working as expected.
> You can find my findings attached to [HER-1175] publicsuffix-based
> queue assignment policy (TopmostAssignedSurtQueueAssignmentPolicy).
>
